This mini back pack is amazing!! There are zippered pockets and pouches everywhere. Sometimes I couldn’t remember which secret pouch I’d stashed something in.  The smallest compartment is perfect for hand sanitizer, chapstick, tissues and small things.  The next pouch back I kept my pens in the pen slots and stored two of my tour’s Vox Box.  The third pouch was great for three of my books and my kindle. It also has a pouch for a battery pack with a cord to plug into it. Just bring a charge cable for your device and plug it into the USB attachment on the outside of the pack. 16oz water bottle would fit, no problem.  The back pouch was great for skinny items. I kept a Manila file full of travel docs in it.  My favorite zippered pouch was in the back of the backpack. We kept our RFID passport wallets in there. Because it rested firmly on my back I never worried someone was getting into the pouch. And I loved not needing a money belt!  The straps are adjustable and the bag is not cumbersome in size. It really is a small backpack that I took into all restaurants.  We used this on a 12 day tour of Germany. It stowed easily on the tour bus under the seat and in the narrow overhead storage. On the airplane I could stow under the seat in front of me and still have room for my feet. After 12 days of getting dragged and shoved everywhere the bag looks like new. It’s very sturdy and well made. This bag is my new favorite travel accessory.  UPDATE: Got my son’s Chromebook in the back pouch too! In addition to the books and everything mentioned above! W O W !
I needed a medium backpack for my upcoming trip. This is smaller than what I'm use to but there's plenty of room. A few pockets but not so many that it's overwhelming.
